title: Bucks back Turner with win after ex-Pacer booed
content: Myles Turner was disheartened by the boos he got from Pacers fans in his return to Indiana, but Milwaukee got the last laugh with Giannis Antetokounmpo's buzzer-beater sealing the win.

title: Morant mum on feelings after return from ban
content: Grizzlies star Ja Morant returned from his one-game suspension and had 18 points and 10 assists in a loss to the Pistons.

title: Loss hikes Cowboys' desperation as deadline nears
content: A 27-17 loss to the Cardinals on Monday night pushed the Cowboys 3½ games behind the Eagles in the NFC East, and with the trade deadline Tuesday, owner Jerry Jones is mulling any potential deal that could help his club secure a postseason berth.

title: Gannon: Brissett still backup after win vs. Dallas
content: Despite Jacoby Brissett leading the Cardinals to their first win since mid-September, coach Jonathan Gannon said he isn't changing course on his starting quarterback.

title: Sources: Ravens deal for Titans edge rusher Jones
content: The Ravens are acquiring edge rusher Dre'Mont Jones from the Titans in exchange for a conditional fifth-round pick, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Conte, architect of BALCO scandal, dies at 75
content: Victor Conte, the architect of a scheme to provide undetectable performance-enhancing drugs to professional athletes, including baseball stars Barry Bonds, Jason Giambi and Olympic track champion Marion Jones decades ago, died Monday. He was 75.

title: C's Brown irate at apparent no-call: 'Unacceptable'
content: Celtics star wing Jaylen Brown was irate after an apparent no-call late in Monday's 105-103 loss to the Utah Jazz that he said "cost us the game."

title: Peat wows in debut as Arizona beats No. 3 Florida
content: Freshman Koa Peat scored 30 points to lead No. 13 Arizona to a 93-87 win over third-ranked and reigning national champion Florida in the Hall of Fame Series on Monday night.

title: NFL trade grades: Will Dre'Mont Jones upgrade the Ravens?
content: Let's size up deals leading into the Tuesday NFL trade deadline, including the Ravens getting pass-rush help.

title: Big night for freshmen, more surprises and takeaways from men's openers
content: Koa Peat's 30 points in the Wildcats' win over the reigning champs highlights big night of freshmen debuts.

title: A top-10 upset, Latson's Gamecocks debut and an Iowa breakout: Women's college hoops is back!
content: Baylor's top-10 upset of Duke and Ta'Niya Latson's 20-point debut helped open the women's 2025-26 season Monday.

title: From Kyle Schwarber to Alex Bregman: Best fits for top free agents
content: Free agency starts Thursday at 5 p.m. ET. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: Barnwell: Two days after Halloween, four Super Bowl contenders proved to be not-so-scary
content: Have the Bills solved the Chiefs? Did Colts QB Daniel Jones regress? Do the Packers and Lions have underlying concerns, and could either make a trade?

title: Tottenham have big problems; Haaland lifts Man City again; Griezmann scores 200; more
content: All is clearly not well with Tottenham after this weekend's lopsided 1-0 defeat to Chelsea. Plus: Spalletti's Juve debut ends in a win, Erling Haaland keeps scoring for Man City and Antoine Griezmann hits 200.

title: Power Rankings: Does anyone stand a chance against KC?
content: The 2025 NWSL regular season is in the rearview mirror, so ESPN takes a look at the eight playoff teams and ranks them from first to worst.

title: AP Week 10 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: There wasn't much drama in the top 5, with Alabama and Texas A&M idle, but Georgia did squeak out a win.

title: Buzz: What is Jayden Daniels' injury outlook going forward?
content: Look beyond the fantasy points leaderboard to see who got the carries, the targets and the opportunities.

title: Kyle Larson's NASCAR Cup crown comes at Denny Hamlin's heartbreaking expense
content: Kyle Larson won his second NASCAR title on Sunday, but even he didn't feel right seeing another championship slip through Denny Hamlin's fingers.

title: First bets for Week 10: Browns and Eagles to cover in Week 10, plus an MVP pick
content: What lines offered immediate value once odds came out? Here are four early bets and a futures wager to track.

title: Fantasy basketball pickups: Ryan Rollins, Quentin Grimes add instant offense
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news:  Napoli 'aggressively pushing' for Man United's Mainoo
content: A midseason move for Manchester United midfielder Kobbie Mainoo is in Napoli's sights. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Women's World Cup: A '1983' Moment Again, And The Dawn Of Desi Dominance
content: The historical injustices and institutional apathy have been answered with a World Cup trophy by the women. This victory must not be treated as an anomaly. It should be recognised as the dawn of a new era for cricket in India.

title: 7 Climbers Killed As Avalanche Hits Base Camp Of Nepal's Yalung Ri Peak
content: An avalanche at a mountain base camp in eastern Nepal killed seven people, including three Italians, an expedition organiser said Tuesday, as efforts were underway to retrieve their remains.

title: On Camera, Andhra Teacher Gets Foot Massage From Students, Suspended
content: A video of a teacher getting a foot massage from students during school hours in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam district is viral. The teacher was issued a suspension notice soon after the video caught the attention of the authorities.

title: UP's Pilgrimage Push As PM Modi Prepares For 'Dhwaj' Ceremony In Ayodhya
content: Over the past eight years, the Yogi Adityanath government has spent thousands of crores to modernise and connect its temple towns.

title: Exclusive: Mohan Yadav On Bihar Polls, Anant Singh And His Cabinet Reshuffle
content: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav is among NDA's star campaigners for the Bihar assembly polls.

title: 3 Men Who Raped Student In Coimbatore Were Drunk, Hit Her Friend With Sickle
content: The three men were arrested after a brief encounter with the police this morning. They were shot in the leg and taken to the hospital.

title: UP Man Seen Spitting On Rotis At Wedding, Arrested After Video Goes Viral
content: A man has been arrested after he was seen spitting on rotis at a wedding in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr. Danish was also caught on camera spitting on rotis as he made them.

title: Who Is New York Mayoral Candidate Andrew Cuomo, Endorsed By Trump
content: In 2021, Andrew Cuomo resigned from the post of the Governor of New York following a state investigation that found he had sexually harassed multiple women.

title: "Screamed For Help": Bengal Woman Beaten Up By Bengaluru Cops For 3 Hours
content: A 34-year-old domestic worker from West Bengal and her husband were allegedly brutally assaulted by the Bengaluru police for three hours on charges of stealing a diamond ring from her employer's house.

title: On Camera, Girl Returning From Coaching Shot Twice By Stalker In Faridabad
content: In a chilling stalker attack, a man opened fire on a 17-year-old girl at Ballabhgarh in Haryana's Faridabad district, about 40 km from the Delhi border. The teenager has been hospitalised, and police are looking for the shooter.

title: "Zerodha Scam": Investor Complains Of Rs 5 Crore Withdrawal Limit, CEO Responds
content: The investor said that Zerodha's platform limited withdrawals to Rs 5 crore per day, calling it a "scam".

title: ChatGPT Go Now Free In India For 12 Months: A Complete Guide
content: ChatGPT Go is OpenAI's affordable version of its premium AI chatbot, designed to bridge the gap between the free and Plus plans.

title: Inside Canada's Mass Visa Cancellation Plan That May Target Indians
content: Amid concerns over possible fraud, Canadian authorities are reportedly seeking the power to cancel applications for a group of visa holders, including some Indians.

title: Emissions, Climate Finance, Forests: COP30 Agenda In Focus
content: At COP30, the hosts will launch a new, innovative global fund that proposes rewarding countries with high tropical forest cover that keep trees standing instead of chopping them down.

title: 4 Terrorists Hiding In Village Shot Dead In Army's Dawn Operation In Manipur
content: Four terrorists of the United Kuki National Army (UKNA) were shot dead in an encounter with the security forces in Manipur this morning, a defence spokesperson said.

title: India's Russian Oil Imports Rise By Nearly 3% In October: Report
content: India's crude oil imports from Russia are expected to have risen slightly in October from a month earlier, according to preliminary ship-tracking data from Kpler and OilX, in spite of pressure from Washington to cut purchases.

title: Why A Chef Refused To Cook Vegan Dinner For Prince William In Amazon Forest
content: Saulo Jennings, 47-year-old chef is ready to impress heads of state at the COP30 meeting in the Amazon this week with an immersive dinner showcasing both plant and animal ingredients from the world's largest rainforest.

title: Thane Scooty Rider Kicks Biker In Real-Life "Road Rash". Then Cops Did This
content: The video of the incident begins with men riding bikes and scooters in a suburb in Thane. In between, we see a man, riding solo, stand on his scooter and try and kick two other men riding a two-wheeler close to him.

title: 'If they make too much fuss …': Lalan Singh’s warning sparks row; FIR filed after video examination
content: Union minister Lalan Singh has sparked controversy by urging Janata Dal (United) workers to confine opposition leaders on polling day.  The Rashtriya Janata Dal condemned the remarks, accusing the minister of undermining the Election Commission. This statement comes amid campaigning for a JD(U) candidate currently in jail.

title: 'Put on a whole show about Chhath Puja': Rahul’s ‘drama’ barb at PM Modi; takes swipe at Nitish
content: Rahul Gandhi accused PM Modi of staging a Chhath Puja 'drama,' alleging a special pipe was used for his Yamuna bath. Gandhi also criticized Modi for distracting youth with social media, diverting attention from unemployment and health issues. This exchange occurs amidst a heated Bihar election campaign where Modi had previously targeted the opposition over the festival.

title: New regional force? Northeast parties announce merger; Conrad Sangma leads charge
content: Leaders from four Northeast regional parties, including Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma, have announced plans to merge into a single political entity. This move aims to amplify the region's voice and represent its people's aspirations. A committee will now define the structure and strategy for this historic unification, though some key regional players are currently not participating.

title: '43yrs in maximum-security prison': Indian-origin man wrongly jailed in US; court halts deportation
content: Indian-origin man, Subramanyam Vedam, faces deportation from the US after spending over four decades in prison for a murder conviction later overturned.  Despite being a legal permanent resident since infancy, he was taken into immigration custody upon release. Courts have now halted his deportation, offering a glimmer of hope for the exonerated man.

title: ‘Rs 100 crore assets’: UP DySP hidden empire busted; SIT links him to Kanpur extortion gang
content: A Deputy Superintendent of Police in Uttar Pradesh, Rishikant Shukla, faces a vigilance inquiry after an SIT probe uncovered nearly ₹100 crore in alleged illegal wealth. The investigation revealed links to a Kanpur-based lawyer's extortion syndicate, which reportedly used fabricated cases and land grabbing. Shukla's assets are deemed disproportionate to his known income.

title: Big AI freebie: ChatGPT Go now free for 12 months in India; how to claim the offer
content: OpenAI is offering ChatGPT Go free for 12 months to users in India starting November 4, 2025. Eligible users include new sign-ups, free-tier users, and existing ChatGPT Go subscribers with accounts in good standing. The promotion provides access to GPT-5, advanced image generation, file uploads, data analysis tools, and custom GPTs at no cost. Users must add a payment method to redeem but won't be charged during the promotional period. This limited-time offer can be redeemed via web, Android, or iOS platforms.

title: 'Never stop dreaming': Harman’s heartfelt message after historic World Cup win – watch
content: Harmanpreet Kaur's childhood dream materialized as India clinched their maiden World Cup title, defeating South Africa by 52 runs. Recalling her humble beginnings with a modified bat, Kaur emphasized the power of unwavering dreams and perseverance.

title: Bihar: Bridge collapses in Araria; built in 2019 for Rs 4 crore, traffic movement halted
content: A middle pillar of a four-crore rupee bridge in Bihar's Araria district collapsed on Monday, causing no injuries. The bridge, built in 2019 and connecting Forbesganj with Pategna village, has had all traffic halted. A technical team is investigating the incident, which follows a dozen bridge collapses in the state last year.

title: IPL Auction: SRH to release Klaasen? Franchises keep tabs on ex-Proteas batter
content: Heinrich Klaasen, retained for Rs 23 crore, produced 487 runs in IPL 2025 but majority of his runs came in two knocks with rest littered in cameos. A season prior, he scored four fifties in run to the final for SRH. Going into the mini auction next month, Klaasen could be released to beef up the purse.

title: 'Creativity is connecting the dots': Steve Jobs' success mantra revealed—practice backed by neuroscience
content: Steve Jobs emphasized that true intelligence lies in connecting overlooked ideas, not just knowing facts. He believed diverse life experiences are crucial for creativity, enabling individuals to draw from a rich mental library. By actively seeking new experiences and practicing self-awareness, one can unlock the brain's creative power and gain a significant advantage.

title: Exclusive: Sonakshi Sinha opens up about interfaith wedding with Zaheer Iqbal
content: Sonakshi Sinha and Zaheer Iqbal, married in June 2024, have become a beloved B-town couple, with Sinha emphasizing that love triumphs over hate.  They recently humorously addressed pregnancy rumors and Sinha also commented on weight gain post-marriage, attributing it to marital happiness.

title: Faridabad horror: 17-year-old girl shot by jilted lover; attack caught on cam
content: A 17-year-old student was shot by a motorcyclist in Faridabad's Shyam Colony while returning from a library. The assailant fired a country-made pistol, hitting her shoulder and hand. Locals attempted to apprehend the fleeing attacker, who discarded his weapon. The girl is stable and receiving treatment. Police are investigating the motive and have identified a suspect.

title: China shuts door: Nvidia CEO warns US risks losing global AI edge
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang urged the US government to reconsider restrictions on China, warning that barring the company from the Chinese market risks ceding AI talent to rivals. Despite significant losses in China due to US export controls, Nvidia is securing major deals with the US Department of Energy, including supercomputers for national security.

title: ‘Nothing short of massacre’: Eyewitness recalls Jaipur dumper horror that killed 14
content: A horrific accident unfolded in Harmada, Jaipur, when a rogue dumper truck, careening at over 100 km/h, collided with 17 vehicles, tragically claiming 14 lives and injuring 13 others. Eyewitnesses reported the driver appeared to be under the influence of alcohol.

title: Rs 2.2L tax penalty on retired govt employee: Gratuity exemption under dispute
content: A retired government employee successfully appealed a penalty after mistakenly claiming an excess gratuity tax exemption. The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal ruled in her favor, stating no misreporting occurred and she qualified for immunity under Section 270AA for paying the assessed tax.

title: From Lahli to Navi Mumbai: Shafali Verma's return gift to idol Sachin
content: Twelve years after a nine-year-old Shafali Verma begged her father to take her to Lahli to see Sachin Tendulkar, the Rohtak girl returned the favour, gifting her idol a World Cup in his own backyard. With Tendulkar in the stands, Shafali’s bat and ball did the talking as life came full circle.

title: Indonesia’s 25000-year-old pyramid challenges the understanding of ancient history
content: A recent study claimed Gunung Padang in Indonesia is a 25,000-year-old pyramid. This challenged established timelines of human civilization. Experts questioned the findings, citing a lack of evidence. The study was later retracted. The controversy highlights debates on ancient structures and early human capabilities. It fuels imagination about prehistoric societies.

title: Betting big on gold: Central banks continue to buy gold in a big way
content: Global central banks significantly boosted gold reserves in Q3 2025, adding 220 tonnes, a 28% quarterly jump. India's RBI acquired 600 kilos, reaching 880 tonnes. Despite higher prices, this strategic move signals confidence in gold as a safe haven, with Kazakhstan and Brazil leading recent purchases.

title: Blake Treinen’s viral Charlie Kirk hat: What’s the real story?
content: A viral photo of Blake Treinen wearing a "Charlie Kirk" hat was falsely linked to the Dodgers' 2025 World Series win. The image actually dates back to a September 12 game, weeks before the championship, honoring a fallen TPUSA founder. Fact-checkers confirmed Treinen did not wear the tribute hat during the World Series celebration.

title: Brittany Mahomes slams “disgusting” Bills fan stunt ahead of Chiefs vs Bills
content: Ahead of the Chiefs-Bills game, a past incident involving Brittany Mahomes and a fan display in Buffalo has resurfaced. She publicly condemned a disrespectful Kermit the Frog puppet mocking Patrick Mahomes, urging for basic decency. This reminder of respect underscores the intense rivalry, proving that even amidst fierce competition, human dignity remains paramount.

title: Coimbatore gang rape: Survivor unable to identify attackers; cops probe migrant clusters
content: A 20-year-old postgraduate student was abducted and gang-raped in Coimbatore after her boyfriend was attacked. Three men on a moped assaulted the couple, then took the woman to a deserted area. Police arrested three suspects from Madurai after an encounter, but the survivor could not identify them due to CCTV glare.

title: New York mayor election: Mamdani responds to Trump’s threat to block NYC funds
content: New York City mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani responded to US President Donald Trump's threat to cut federal funds by stating the former president is "threatened" by his campaign. Mamdani argued that Trump's actions highlight a contrast in priorities, with his campaign focused on addressing the cost of living for working-class New Yorkers.

title: Lenskart IPO: GMP of eyewear giant slips on last day; what should investors do?
content: Lenskart's Rs 7,278-crore IPO is seeing strong investor interest, with subscriptions reaching 2.02 times the offered shares by the second day. Despite a slight dip in its grey market premium, brokerages remain optimistic, recommending long-term investment due to the company's market position and growth potential.

title: Joe Alwyn’s old comments on Taylor Swift resurface as fans compare Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift's love life has shifted from a private romance with Joe Alwyn to a public spectacle with Travis Kelce. While Alwyn offered quiet devotion, Kelce brings an open, expressive joy. Friends say Swift is glowing, embracing this new chapter with confidence and living her love story out loud, on her own terms.

title: 'Lured him to Cafe trap': Bengaluru man stalks TV actor, sends vulgar clips; arrested
content: A Bengaluru man, Naveen K Mon, was arrested for stalking and sending obscene content to a TV actress. He persisted with harassment across multiple profiles even after being blocked. The actress lured him to a meeting where she warned him, then alerted the police. He was taken into custody and faces charges under new criminal code sections.

title: Gold price today: How much 22K, 24K gold costs in your city — Check prices
content: Gold prices saw a dip in domestic futures trade today, influenced by a steady dollar and easing US-China trade tensions, which diminished its safe-haven status. Globally, Comex gold futures also traded lower. This decline reflects a firm dollar and reduced expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut next month.

title: Rangers’ touching gesture toward Kraken’s Brandon Montour shows true sportsmanship
content: The New York Rangers showed remarkable compassion before their game against the Seattle Kraken. Comforting defenseman Brandon Montour after his brother passed from ALS. The heartfelt moment, led by Adam Fox. This highlighted the human side of hockey. By proving that respect and empathy can transcend team colors. Even in one of the NHL’s most competitive settings.

title: ‘Mass Jathara’: Salary to budget; key facts about Ravi Teja and Sreeleela’s action drama
content: 'Mass Jathara', the latest offering from Ravi Teja, is holding its own at the box office, receiving a blend of reviews that range from lukewarm to warm. The film, created with a budget of Rs 70 crore, showcases Teja in the role of a transport officer battling against a menacing drug lord.

title: 'Did it out of curiosity': Passenger tries to open emergency exit on Akasa air flight; panic ensues
content: A passenger on an Akasa Air flight from Varanasi to Mumbai was detained after attempting to open an emergency exit before takeoff. The pilot returned the aircraft to the apron, and security escorted passengers off. The passenger claimed he acted out of curiosity and has been booked.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper: What issues have been flagged by Railway ministry in first train?
content: Indian Railways is gearing up for the Vande Bharat sleeper train launch, but quality concerns regarding furnishings and craftsmanship have surfaced.  The Railway Board has identified several deficiencies, urging immediate remedial actions and design enhancements for future rakes.

title: Coimbatore: Out with friend, PG student abducted, gang-raped near airport; 3 held after encounter
content: A 20-year-old student was abducted and gang-raped in Coimbatore after her car was attacked by three men. The assailants assaulted her boyfriend before taking her to a secluded area. Police apprehended three suspects from Madurai district after a manhunt. The survivor is receiving medical attention, and investigations are ongoing.

title: See pics: Bhumi Pednekar stuns in Rs 6.87 lakh saree at Vedant Birla–Tejal Kulkarni reception
content: Dropping an appearance at the wedding reception of Yash and Avanti Birla's son Vedant Birla to Tejal Kulkarni last evening, Bhumi Pednekar turned up the glamour quotient to the fullest. Pednekar showcased a look defined by unconventional luxury and traditional artistry with a Tarun Tahiliani saree. However, it is the remarkable price tag that has caught the internet's attention: the opulent ensemble is worth a staggering Rs. 6.87 lakhs.

title: ‘Stranger Things 5’: Millie Bobby Brown filed complaint against Harbour before shooting began
content: Millie Bobby Brown has reportedly filed a formal complaint against co-star David Harbour, alleging harassment and bullying before the filming of 'Stranger Things' final season. The investigation reportedly lasted months, with claims not mentioning sexual misconduct. Harbour previously expressed fatherly affection and protective feelings for Brown.

title: Refund relief ahead? DGCA drafts new rules for flyers; what it means for passengers
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) is proposing new rules to improve passenger refunds, aiming for airlines to process refunds within 21 days, even for tickets bought via travel agents. Passengers may also get a 48-hour window to cancel or amend tickets without extra charges, except for fare differences, for flights booked directly with airlines.

title: Can the US Supreme Court put an end to Trump’s tariffs, or are they 'here to stay?
content: The US Supreme Court will hear arguments on President Trump's global tariff strategy, with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent representing the administration. The court will determine if Trump exceeded his authority using the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) to impose tariffs. Bessent emphasized the economic emergency and national security aspects, asserting tariffs are here to stay through other legal avenues.

title: Asia Cup: 14-year-old to open for India versus Pakistan; Jitesh Sharma to lead
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, a T20 century record-holder, has been selected for the India A squad in the Rising Stars Asia Cup. He will open the batting with IPL sensation Priyansh Arya. The tournament, featuring India A in Group B with Oman, UAE, and Pakistan A, runs from November 14-23 in Doha.

title: Guru Nanak Jayanti 2025: Check state-wise school holiday list
content: Schools across several Indian states, including Punjab, Haryana, Delhi, Uttarakhand, and Himachal Pradesh, will remain closed on 5 November 2025 to mark Guru Nanak Jayanti, commemorating the birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev Ji. The festival, celebrated with devotion and community service, holds immense significance in Sikhism. However, states like Maharashtra, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, and West Bengal will keep schools open, while Uttar Pradesh allows district administrations to decide holiday observance locally.

title: Women's WC: 3 Indians in Team of the Tournament; Wolvaardt to lead
content: The ICC has announced the Women's Cricket World Cup Team of the Tournament, featuring three players each from champions India and runners-up South Africa. Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah Rodrigues, and Deepti Sharma represent India, while Laura Wolvaardt captains the side alongside other Proteas stars. Australia also secured three spots in the elite 11-player lineup.

title: FDA approves first drug for Thymidine Kinase 2 Deficiency: All we know about this very rare mitochondrial disease
content: A groundbreaking FDA approval offers the first-ever treatment for ultra-rare Thymidine Kinase 2 Deficiency (TK2d). KYGEVVI, a combination therapy, provides hope for children and adults by addressing impaired mitochondrial DNA production. This milestone marks a significant advancement in mitochondrial medicine, potentially transforming care for those with this devastating genetic disorder.

title: Gold Monetisation Scheme: How to unlock the value of your idle gold - explained
content: Gold Monetisation Scheme offers interest on deposited gold, transforming it into a productive asset. However, low uptake is attributed to sentimental value. For those seeking liquidity without losing ownership, gold loans provide an accessible alternative, allowing borrowers to retain their jewellery while unlocking its value.

title: Groww IPO opens today: Should you subscribe? Check price range, GMP & more
content: Investment app Groww's much-anticipated IPO opened Tuesday, aiming to raise Rs 6,632 crore with a price band of Rs 95-100. The company secured over Rs 2,984 crore from anchor investors. Analysts suggest subscribing for the long term, citing strong fundamentals and India's low demat penetration, despite regulatory risks.

title: Maal card explained — Oman’s new national payment card and what it means for you
content: Oman is launching its own national payment card, the 'Ma'al' Card, to boost financial independence and cut costs. This initiative by the Central Bank of Oman offers zero fees for customers and lower transaction costs for merchants, aligning with Oman Vision 2040. Initially for domestic use, it promises to revolutionize digital transactions across the Sultanate.

title: Splitsvilla X6: Karan Kundrra joins Sunny Leone as the new co-host of the reality show
content: Splitsvilla returns for its 16th season with Sunny Leone and a new co-host, Karan Kundrra.  This dynamic duo is set to bring a fresh, electrifying energy to the villa as they guide contestants through the unpredictable landscape of modern love.  Karan expresses his excitement for this homecoming, anticipating a bolder and more surprising season filled with high-stakes decisions.

title: Midday horror in Bengaluru: Man flashes at woman walking dog on Domlur Road; police launch manhunt
content: A 33-year-old woman in Bengaluru was allegedly sexually harassed by an unidentified man while walking her dog. The accused reportedly flashed and acted obscenely towards her on November 1. Police are reviewing CCTV footage to identify the suspect, and a case has been registered under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita.

title: Sikh pilgrims enter Pakistan, first major crossing since May conflict
content: More than 2,100 pilgrims were granted visas to attend a 10-day festival marking 556th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak, Pakistan’s High Commission (embassy) in New Delhi said

title: PMK MLA Arul’s car attacked in Salem during clash between supporters of Anbumani and Ramadoss
content: “They attacked the car with stones, wooden logs, and iron rods. If I had come out of the car, they would have killed me,” the MLA claimed.

title: Supreme Court concerned over misuse of POCSO cases, says awareness needed
content: Supreme Court raised concerns about the misuse of the POCSO Act in marital disputes and urged awareness campaigns, as a PIL highlighted gaps in understanding sexual offence laws

title: Women’s World Cup: Maharashtra to felicitate Jemimah Rodrigues, Smriti Mandhana and Radha Yadav
content: On November 2, 2025, the Indian women’s cricket team won its maiden World Cup title, defeating South Africa in the final at Navi Mumbai

title: Former Karnataka minister H.Y. Meti passes away in Bengaluru
content: Meti, an influential Kuruba community leader from Northern Karnataka, was elected to the Legislative Assembly in 1989 and 2004. He served as the Excise Minister in the previous Siddaramaiah government (2013-18).

title: Mandhana, Jemimah, Deepti named in ICC Women's World Cup Team of Tournament
content: Named Player of the Tournament, Deepti was instrumental in India's title-winning campaign; she finished as the leading wicket-taker and scored crucial runs across the tournament.

title: Watch: Coimbatore assault case: Three arrested, shot while fleeing police
content: Police in Coimbatore arrested three men accused of sexually assaulting a 20-year-old college student near the city’s international airport on November 2. Officials said the suspects were shot in the legs when they tried to escape during the operation.

title: ED searches in Nagaland human hair export FEMA case
content: Despite considerable lapse of time, the company failed to submit requisite export documentation such as shipping bills, export invoice copies amongst others to the authorised dealer bank within prescribed timelines, ED officials said.

title: Women’s World Cup: PM Modi to felicitate Indian squad on November 5
content: The Board of Control for Cricket in India is unlikely to organise a victory parade for Harmanpreet’s Hurricanes

title: In challenge against SIR expansion, DMK flags exercise infringes voters' right to political expression
content: The DMK has challenged the Election Commission’s electoral roll revision in 12 States, claiming it threatens voter rights and undermines fair elections, warning of potential disenfranchisement

title: Passenger detained for trying to open emergency exit on flight at Varanasi airport
content: As the aircraft was taxiing towards the runway, the passenger, Sujit Singh, a resident of Gaura Badshahpur in Jaunpur district, attempted to open the emergency exit, police said

title: West Bengal school recruitment scam: School Service Commission publishes list of ‘tainted’ non-teaching staff
content: 3000 ‘Untainted’ question why they are being punished even when WBSSC has the list of ‘tainted’ candidates; raise concern over non-payment of salary over last 8 months

title: Cough syrup tragedy: SIT arrests wife of accused Dr. Praveen Soni
content: Jyoti Soni is the proprietor of a medical shop from where the cough syrup was sold to several victims, the official said.

title: CM Revanth to lay foundation for Akshaya Patra mega kitchen spread over 2 acres in Telangana’s Kodangal
content: The foundation has already been implementing the breakfast scheme in Kodangal since December, serving over 28,000 students across 312 schools

title: ‘I am broken’: Sole survivor of Air India Ahmedabad plane crash appeals for welfare package
content: Radd Seiger, a UK-based retired lawyer, has taken charge as Ramesh’s spokesperson and appealed to Air India CEO Campbell Wilson to meet with the family to be able to fully assess and address the gravity of the situation.

title: AIADMK rebel MLA Manoj Pandian joins DMK
content: Mr. Pandian said he would resign from his MLA post later in the day; his defection is seen as setback to O. Panneerselvam, who recently gained the support of K.A. Sengottaiyan

title: Four elephants fall into well in Chhattisgarh; rescue operation on
content: “The incident was reported in the morning at Hardi village in the wildlife sanctuary,” Principal Chief Conservator of Forests (Wildlife) Arun Kumar Pandey said

title: 27 injured in Telangana’s Karimnagar RTC bus-tractor crash; 4 hurt in Nalgonda private bus-tractor accident
content: The accidents occurred a day after 19 people died in RTC-tipper lorry crash in Chevella of Rangareddy

title: India's top 1% grew its wealth by 62% since 2000: G20 report
content: The study, led by Nobel laureate Joseph Stiglitz, warns that global inequality has reached "emergency" levels

title: No charges on cancellation within 48 hours: DGCA proposes significant changes to air ticket refund norms
content: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has proposed that in case of purchase of a ticket through a travel agent/portal, the "onus of refund shall lie with the airlines”

title: Watch: What to know about Election Commission’s voter list revision 2.0 | Explainer
content: The Election Commission has begun the second phase of its Special Intensive Revision of Electoral Rolls, covering over 51 crore voters across 12 states and Union Territories. In this explainer, Sreeparna Chakrabarty looks at what’s different this time and what it means for voters.

title: T.N. MLA Sengottaiyan urges ECI to expedite inquiry into ‘Two Leaves’ symbol issue
content: Sengottaiyan tells ECI that the faction led by Edappadi K. Palaniswami does not represent the original AIADMK

title: Voting goes underway for JNUSU elections
content: Counting will begin at 9 p.m., and the final results will be declared on November 6, according to the election committee.

title: CPJ seeks security for journalist Rana Ayyub and her father
content: “The threats of violence made against Rana Ayyub and her father from an unknown international number are deeply concerning,” said CPJ’s India representative Kunal Majumder

title: Fugitive Mehul Choksi challenges extradition in Belgium Supreme Court
content: India has given a number of assurances to Belgium regarding Choksi's safety, the charges that he would face during trial in India, prison arrangements, human rights and medical needs.

title: Magnitude 4 earthquake in Andhra’s Alluri District, gives tremors to residents in nearby Vizag city
content: “I felt a few jolts in my bed. I woke up immediately and got up.  I did not feel much,” a resident of PM Palem said

title: Kerala Waqf Board to challenge HC Division Bench’s verdict on Munambam land
content: A two-member Bench consisting of Justice Sushrut Arvind Dharmadhikari and Justice V. M. Shyamkumar had passed the judgment last month in a writ petition filed by the State government challenging a Single Judge’s order striking down the appointment of an inquiry commission into the Munambam issue.

title: First Juvenile Huntington’s Disease brain donated to NIMHANS for research
content: The deceased, Jagadeesha, who was 12, hailed from Kalagotla village in Yemmiganur mandal of Kurnool district, Andhra Pradesh, was first evaluated at NIMHANS in 2017

title: Coimbatore gang rape: Police arrest three men after shooting them in legs
content: Coimbatore City Police Commissioner A. Saravana Sundar said the trio was in an inebriated condition when they committed the crime. Two of them, who are siblings, have murder and theft cases pending against them.

title: ‘Demands to be discussed with CM within 15 days’: Jain monk ends indefinite fast over pigeon feeding issue in Mumbai
content: After the Bombay HC order, the BMC recently allowed controlled feeding of pigeons at four locations — Worli Reservoir, the mangrove area on Lokhandwala Back Road in Andheri West, the Airoli-Mulund check post area, and Gorai ground in Borivali West

title: CM Bhupendra Patel visits rain-affected Gujarat villages, reviews crop damage
content: Unseasonal rains that began in the last week of October damaged crops in several districts. Survey operations were launched to assess the extent of damage

title: Coimbatore gang rape: a hang-out for anti-social elements that turned into crime scene
content: The vacant areas along a mud road linking Brindhavan Nagar and SIHS Colony have become a hotspot for drinking, substance abuse: residents

title: Haryana cabinet approves job support for families of 1984 anti-Sikh riot victims
content: In another decision, the cabinet approved the Teachers' Transfer Policy, 2025, replacing the existing Teachers' Transfer Policy, 2023

title: Restructuring of Panjab University’s senate-syndicate has exposed ‘BJP’s anti-Punjab face’, says ex-Cong min
content: Mr. Sidhu stated that under the pretext of improving the functioning of Panjab University, the Central government has almost eliminated the representation of teachers, principals, and alumni in its syndicate

title: Dynastic politics 'grave threat' to Indian democracy: Shashi Tharoor
content: Mr. Tharoor said that when political power is determined by lineage rather than ability, commitment, or grassroots engagement, the quality of governance suffers

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Modi invokes katta jibe again, Priyanka slams PM, Kharge says Nitish ‘in BJP’s lap’
content: All top leaders of the NDA and Mahagathbandhan were busy touring Bihar and trading barbs as the campaign for the polls intensified

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta heads to Bihar for three-day campaigning in Assembly polls
content: Ms. Gupta will address a public meeting in Bankipur Assembly constituency, after reaching the State capital Patna. She will also campaign in Siwan, Barharia, Baikunthpur and nearby areas on 4 November

title: BJP delegation meets ECI officials, demands vetting of Bengal government’s citizenship documents for SIR
content: The memorandum submitted by the BJP leadership to the ECI stated that ground realities in West Bengal are different from Bihar and alleged that the State has witnessed large-scale issuance of backdated and forged documents which should be vetted during SIR

title: Take proactive steps to reduce pollution, SC tells authorities
content: Amicus curiae and senior advocate Aparajita Singh highlighted media reports indicating that several air quality monitoring stations in Delhi had not functioned during the Deepavali festival days.

title: Former BJD Rajya Sabha MP Amar Patnaik joins BJP
content: Months ago, Patnaik, a former accountant general, played key role in leading BJD’s charge on alleged discrepancy and irregularities in 2024 elections and how it benefited BJP

title: Mushrooms key to achieving nutritional security, says UAS-B VC
content: ‘Even though mushroom cultivation is a promising venture, the existing market in India was very limited compared to China and other countries’

title: M.P. govt. wants to opt out of decentralised procurement system
content: Congress slams Bharatiya Janata Party government, accuses it of betraying farmers and pushing them “into a serious crisis”; State says “government is committed to purchasing every grain“

title: Bombay HC clears way for 26/11 mastermind Abu Jundal’s trial
content: Judge quashes order passed by trial court asking the authorities to produce documents related to the arrest of the accused

title: Karnataka announces ₹600 crore fund to push ‘Deep Tech Decade’
content: This initiative reflects our vision to create a robust DeepTech pipeline supporting entrepreneurs working on technologies such as AI, ML, quantum computing, advanced manufacturing, robotics, and sustainability-driven innovation, says Priyank Kharge

title: BJP formed govt. with stolen votes, alleges former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik
content: BJP government is not a game-changer but a name-changer — a government busy only in rebranding welfare schemes started during BJD government, claims Patnaik

title: Researchers at IIT-M and Ohio State varsity develop AI framework that mimics real-time chemical synthesis
content: They say the framework, named PURE, promises to cut down early stage timelines of drug development, which is sometimes a decades-long process that costs millions of dollars

title: Set up SIT to probe doctor’s death, Supriya Sule urges Fadnavis
content: Doctors’ association calls for systemic reforms to ensure the mental well-being of medical professionals serving in government healthcare institutions

title: Cong government spared no one in its cheating: KTR
content: He said the the government was targeting the poor through the HYDRAA drive, which would raze houses in Borabanda as well if the ruling party secures the seat

title: Allahabad High Court orders ₹50,000 compensation for man jailed in false anti-conversion case
content: The Bench said the case was an example of the “State authorities falling and scrambling over each other in order to score brownie points” on the basis of an FIR

title: SIR is a hurried exercise that aims to terrorise people of West Bengal, says TMC
content: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee will lead a rally in protest against SIR in Kolkata on Tuesday, while the LoP Suvendu Adhikari will be lead a rally in Panihati supporting the SIR

title: Delhi High Court upholds FSSAI ban on sale of beverages with ‘ORS’ branding
content: The Delhi High Court upholds the FSSAI’s order barring companies from using the label ‘ORS’, citing serious health risks for consumers

title: Families of Indians fighting Russia’s war with Ukraine protest, demand safe return of kin
content: The protesting family members said that agents ‘lured’ young men with lucrative job offers and promise of citizenship, and they were sent to the war zone

title: Air India flight diverted to Mongolia due to a technical glitch
content: The airline said that the Boeing 777-300 aircraft was undergoing checks, and it was making efforts to take passengers to their destination

title: Need for shift in focus from food security to nutrition security: PM
content: Modi addresses experts at first Emerging Science Technology and Innovation Conclave, which replaces the Indian Science Congress

title: Farmers’ groups question new tractor emission norms
content: They opposed TREM-IV and TREM-V emission norms for tractors as they could severely increase economic burdens and hardships for farmers

title: Transwomen face closure of shelter as govt. allegedly delays payment of funds
content: The residents, eight transwomen including college students, say they are facing uncertainty over food and shelter as the trust wants them to move out, unwilling to run the shelter home without adequate funds

title: We are one step away from solving climate change: Chemistry Laureate
content: The country is extremely well positioned to build on an innovative sense, said the Scottish chemist, David MacMillan

title: Lakshadweep woman out of danger after treatment for new amoebic brain infection variant, says hospital
content: The patient, who works in Edappally, had been admitted three weeks ago with a severe headache, vomiting, and an eye movement disorder

title: GBA Chief orders urgent action as city misses CM’s pothole deadline
content: He has directed senior officials of all city corporations to personally inspect the roads, identify damaged stretches, and take swift action to fill potholes

title: Kerala Chief Minister to inaugurate KIIFB silver jubilee celebrations on Tuesday
content: According to the Kerala government, KIIFB has to date approved 1,190 projects worth ₹90,562 crore across various sectors

title: ‘Supposed’ trade deal with U.S. seems to have become an ordeal for India, says Congress
content: Congress general secretary Jairam Ramesh says there was a time when it looked like India would host the Quad Summit but that was unlikely now

title: Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls begins in 12 States, Union Territories on November 4
content: This major exercise will cover close to 51 crore voters. The first round of the clean-up exercise was carried out in Bihar earlier this year, during which more than 68 lakh names were deleted from the electoral rolls.

title: Hibi to send letter to Health Minister demanding handover of Corporation building to Ernakulam GH
content: A few members of the Hospital Development Committee (HDC) have also expressed interest in acquiring the premises, citing its potential to ease space constraints and improve healthcare services

title: Where Auburn ranks among the open Power 4 jobs
content: the 2025-26 coaching cycle wasn't expected to be calm, like its predecessor . but few forecast such a robust line of storms rolling through the sport in the first half of the season . all four power conferences have had a firing .

title: Greatest World Series ever? No question for Dodgers-Blue Jays
content: apologies to 1991, the Los Angeles Dodgers and Toronto Blue Jays just finished the greatest World Series . it was the greatest world series because of its compelling storylines, some of which were impossible to believe . the first pinch-hit grand slam in World Series history was the first game to begiard .

title: Jayden Daniels' elbow injury: Answering the most pressing questions
content: the Washington Commanders' ugly season got a whole lot worse . Jayden Daniels was lying on the ground, in pain, after suffering a dislocated elbow . the commanders have been devastated by injuries and player absences since training camp opened .

title: Cardinals finally win: Here's what to know from Week 9, including our main takeaways
content: quarterback Lamar Jackson delivered four touchdown passes in his return from a hamstring injury that sidelined him for three games . the Ravens squeaked by the Falcons after kicker Parker Romo missed a potential tying extra point attempt in the fourth quarter . quarterback Tyler Shough won his fifth straight regular-season matchup against Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes .

title: Premier League 'Big Six' grades: Arsenal an A; Liverpool a D
content: the 2025-26 premier league season has reached a key stage . the so-called traditional "Big Six" have experienced wildly contrasting fortunes on their way to the 10-game mark . every top-flight team have now played 10 league games . four managers have already been fired .

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: a blackout of ESPN and other Disney-owned channels, such as ABC, has been reported . the conflict affects ABC, the ESPN netwo and the foxes . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services .

title: 'It felt like a toxic environment': Stories from four QBs and their 15 schools
content: despite the haters, we've reached a peak moment for journeyman quarterbacks across college football . nearly 40 quarterbacks from the 2020 class came back this year for one more season at the FBS level . they're 23- and 24-year-old grizzled veterans who feel even older inside their locker rooms .

title: Free agent pickups: Key adds ahead of Week 10
content: the ninth Sunday of the season featured a wild, defenseless slugfest in Buffalo . preseason top tight end Brock Bowers scored three touchdowns and a league-high 43.3 PPR points . cam Little blasted the longest field goal in NFL history .

title: NFL Week 9's top performance? Check the fan-voted 'Himmy' Award results
content: a 58-yard touchdown with 17 seconds left gave the Chicago Bears a 47-42 win in a wild finish . the Jacksonville Jaguars edged the Las Vegas Raiders by one point in overtime . this week's matchups were action-packed with standout perforation .

title: CFP top 12: One last projection before the first committee ranking
content: defending national champion Ohio State should start the first college football playoff rankings on Tuesday . there could be some debate over the top spot when the 12 members of this year's group vote on teams for their first official top 25 ranking of the season . the bigger discussion will likely revolve around one-loss Alabama and undefeated Texas A&M for the no. 3 and no. 4 spots .

title: Cardinals snap losing streak, beat Cowboys in Dallas
content: the Arizona Cardinals beat the Dallas Cowboys 27-10 on "Monday Night Football" the Cardinals' offense looked better and more efficient, both statistically and to the naked eye . the offense topped 300 yards for the third straight game after hitting the mark just once .

title: 🏈 CFB Power Ranking: Oregon moves into top 5
content: arch Manning waited until the last possible second before firing the ball to a leaping Emmett Mosley V in the end zone . the longhorns held on for a 34-31 win . he has 674 passing yards and six touchdowns in his past two starts .

title: Tracking every NFL trade deadline move: Dre'Mont Jones to the Ravens, Jaelan Phillips to the Eagles
content: the 2025 trade deadline is Tuesday at 4 p.m. ET . we have you covered on every deal until the final second . a team of reporters has the latest buzz on which players could be moved next and which teams might be looking to upgrade .

title: Resetting the CFP tiers after Week 10 and projecting the first bracket
content: two top-10 teams fell on the road to unranked opponents . a third fell to a lower-ranked team . two-thirds of the 2025 college football season done, we now shift into Playoff Hyperdrive .

title: Cough syrup deaths: MP SIT arrests accused doctor’s wife; booked for hiding proof, aiding husband
content: wife of arrested govt doctor is accused of tampering and destroying key evidence . she ran a medical store in her name and had been on the run for weeks . the toxic batch of coldrif cough syrup found to contain 48.6% diethylene glycol .
